markdown:
<title level="1" right="Creature Family">[Jellyfish](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=140)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 152 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

Many varieties of jellyfish drift through the world’s oceans, feeding on fish and other tiny marine creatures. However, deadly species of monstrous jellyfish pose a threat to unwary swimmers and sailors alike. Note that while jellyfish are animals, they also have the mindless trait because they lack a centralized nervous system.

<title level="2">Members</title>
[Fire Jellyfish Swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=706) (Creature 6), [Giant Jellyfish](/Monsters.aspx?ID=707) (Creature 7)

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png">Jellyfish Species</title>

A large number of types of monstrous jellyfish dwell in the worldfs oceans, each with their own unusual specialty in hunting. The immense vampire jellyfish is a blood-drinking monster that often attacks sailors aboard ships. Among the largest are the dreaded whaler jellyfish, colossal creatures that feed on whales or even [krakens](/Monsters.aspx?ID=275).
</aside>
name: Jellyfish
